website_summaries.verdict: A good buy if you are looking for a basic lightweight tactical pen with a sturdy build, but the writing function doesn't stack up to its overall build.
pros: Both lightweight and heavy duty, thanks to aircraft aluminum material that stands up to tough use
Has a sturdy clip that attaches securely
cons: The ink cartridges have been reported to wobble when writing
Reports of the push-button retracting mechanism failing

customer_reviews.title: Solid, breaks glass with ease... and it writes
customer_reviews.text: I use it every shift at work as a firefighter/medic. It clips on the inside of my turnout pants and stays put. Its solid and has withstood training, EMS calls and structure fires for six months now. Any other pen would break in my pocket. I write patient info with it on EMS calls. I've broken out vehicle windows with it with ease. It works better than a window punch and is easier to deploy because of the clip. Others were impressed with it's quick deployment and it looks like I'm breaking windows with just my gloved hand. The ink recently started to fade and I replaced the cartridge with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Qpounderwidchz

customer_reviews.title: What a steal at less than $10!
customer_reviews.text: This tactical pen is just what everyone needs on the person every day. Sturdy well made and attractive. Writes smoothly and comes with 6 extra refills. I can hear John Wick thinking "should I use this Sminiker tactical pen or a pencil, I think I'll use a pencil". Enjoy😎👍👍
customer_reviews.author: William Williams

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I would call this a self defense pen
customer_reviews.text: This pen would be super useful to break the glass in your car in an emergency. But for self-defense... First of all, a tactical pen should have a flat side so you could apply pressure with your thumb. Instead, the glass breaker is there which hurts when you put your thumb on it. Another reason you absolutely need to use your thumb is to keep the pen in your hand without slipping. If this pen slips in your hand, the clip could split your hand open. Other than that, the knurling is very aggressive, which I like. And it writes very well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Colon

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made for the price but would be nice to have optional attachments
customer_reviews.text: For the price I think it's nicely made and it writes well. I wish, however, that it was more like some of the other pens that have optional attachments such as a small knife blade, bottle opener, can opener, seat belt cutter, etc., that can be switched out. Perhaps Sminiker will add more pens in the future that are more modular. Also, the pen advertised on the Sminiker website appears to come with a sheath, but this one from Amazon does not. It would have been nice if this one had the sheath included.
customer_reviews.author: Mostly Harmless

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Pen
customer_reviews.text: This was super disappointing. The moment I opened the box the ink covered my fingers. The pen came apart, I tried to put it back together but all that happened was more ink everywhere. I have never had a pen that looks sturdy just fall apart so easily. This was super disappointing as I really though this was a great idea for a pen a nurse could use.
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: I love this pen
customer_reviews.text: I love this pen. Writes great as a pen, feels awesome in your hand, has real good weight to it, and it has knurled center so it won't slip out of your hand easily when used as a weapon. Either end will do sufficient damage by either striking, stabbing or scrapping an assailant. I highly recommend this one over all the other I've seen out there and I've checked out many before I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. T

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one day of use.
customer_reviews.text: The pen looks amazing but isn’t ideal for what it says it does. I just received this pen yesterday and already it broke seems like the moving part is this pens biggest flaw. I am without a doubt disappointed and would not recommend this to anyone. I can’t speak to the level of customer service because I haven’t spoken to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Lizandro Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Read before you buy!
customer_reviews.text: Spring broke when trying to replace the ink cartridge. Received the pen today, and it broke today as well. I would not recommend this pen, go with Boker instead. I’ve had a Boker Tactical pen for years and have had any issues. Tried this one for a quick pen at work and it’s a disappointment. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Swimp

customer_reviews.title: One end super reliable; other end is single-use-only.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these before. They are good grip pens, reliable, and easy to hold when writing. The twist-to-open/close movement is smooth and attenuated at the end of travel (fully open). One down side: If you deploy this device from the other end, whatever it strikes is destroyed, but unfortunately, so is the operation of the pen. The entire middle half of the threaded shaft inside broke clean off. Very hard to write with now, so I bought 10 replacements. Now...how about YOU go back and fix the spelling on the second question of your survey above (How "like" will you share....) Thanks,, -Pete No more questions. I'm old and tired.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: It may cost less, but it’s worth more.
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased ABP pens from the FACEBOOK ad at the recommendation of a friend. $20.0 for black, $30.00 for pink. They sucked. Broke within a week, mechanism will just turn and ink will not extend. I bought this one - looks very similar, but it works great. I replaced ink with a Fisher a space Pen refill right of the bat, but it is a great pen. I took the pen apart to see how it works, the guts are very similar to the ABP pen, so I put them in my pink pen. Now the pink pen works the way it should, and I am ordering 5 more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Marc B

customer_reviews.title: Both were steel, refills leaked
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had ordered two pens, actually thought I purchased each from a separate entity. Both were made of steel, and both stated so on the box. at least one of the additional refills had leaked, and provided ink stains inside the Amazon package. However, most disappointing was neither of the pens were |"aircraft aluminum," but bot were quite heavy, made of steel. Great for keeping on my desk, but too heavy for placement in a shirt pocket. Quality is good, except for leaking refill(s).
customer_reviews.author: Jerrell L. Driver

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive tactical pen
customer_reviews.text: For less than 10 bucks I wasn't expecting too much. However this feels very rugged. The sharp pointed glass breaker on the end puts holes in a 2X4 when I pounded on it. The pen did not break and the point was still sharp. Have not had opportunity to see if it breaks car window but it should. The ink cartridge writes nicely as do all 6 of the spares that came with it. The pocket clip holds the pen snug in a pocket. It is removable if you ever need to bend it to tighten or loosen.
customer_reviews.author: Outpost05

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product came well packaged and the extra refills definitely a plus. Pen writes well and of course easy to operate and changing refills is a snap. As far as the glass breaker I am going to have to assume it will work (thus the 4 stars). Definitely sharp but have no idea If it will work, especially on film tinted windows or how much force will be required nor whether my thumb will take the force on the opposite end. Hopefully, I won’t have to find out..
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, writes beautifully, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it a great defensive tool and glass break but it writes superb! I use it daily and carry on me everyday and adore this pen, it has become my favorite pen, it writes so well, does not smear or leak, sturdy and heavy, well made, metal pocket clip is very strong. The twist opening is smooth and well made, nothing is cheap or junky about the pen and comes in a nice professional box with generous number of refills so I expect many many years of enjoyment from this pen and I will be getting more as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Joy N Mills

customer_reviews.title: Stippling May prevent it being used in a uniform shirt
customer_reviews.text: It’s a wonderful pen. I love it and I’ve only had it a short while. The only thing I’d change is the stippling on it is too sharp. Yes, it makes it really grippy, but it’s too grippy to go in my uniform shirt. If they had it with different inserts to slip on for the grip with different levels of grippiness, I think that would be most ideal. As it stands, I’m going to have to sand down the stippling and get the whole pen recoated so it will smoothly slide in and out of the pen pocket on my uniform shirt. Overall it’s a wonderful pen. Great for 8 and a half bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pen
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't had the opportunity to use the glass breaker end, this is just a nice pen to use. It has a good weight and is comfortable to use. I have been using it almost every day and I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: DJLohnes

customer_reviews.title: Best Ink Cartridge
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight and girth, I hate skinny pens, too hard to hold. This pen came with five extra inks and one in the pen! Best of all the ink cartridge can be replaced with the Fisher Space pen cartridges which allow you to write at any angle. A nice surprise was if you register for the warranty they send you a gift. Mine was some extra utensils for the pen!
customer_reviews.author: Alien Warrior Woman

customer_reviews.title: Missing glass braker.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE. I was contacted by the seller and i was sent a new pen back. I am happy with the working glass braker. I am really satisfied with the customer service that was provided by this company. I give them 5 star because of that and 4 for the product because of the first time. Overall i think that i am happy with the new pen. The pen was nice. Strong and well made but but the glass braker or top was missing i am sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Macareno1

customer_reviews.title: Good value for decent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as stocking stuffers for my adult children to keep in their vehicles. As a multi purpose tool it seems adequate. The pen itself works quite well with a good feel. I hope never to have to use the glass breaker so can’t speak to that. It comes with a total of 6 pen refills. Overall I’m happy with the price, quality and function of this product and would say that I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Really nice pen
customer_reviews.text: The pen writes extremely well. It fits good in my hand but after a while the weight becomes an issue but not enough to make me not use it. And the amount of refills they send is fantastic. I would give it 5 stars but nothing is perfect. And I use the glass break as to score lines on metal when I weld or cut. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this pen. Well made and writes perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tact pen for everyday carry. Being female, and our jeans have smaller front pockets, it was a problem. This one works well. I have found sometimes to put it in a pouch pocket of some shirts and especially on the side of my purse. Quick access, yet secure with the clip on the pen. Not looking to use it, but knowing it is there if I do. Also the inkpen part works great.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie Leath

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pen, but kind of heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pen! Due to my line of work, I occasionally have pens break in my pocket. It's so nice to have one that I don't have to worry about breaking! It is quite a bit heavier than most pens, so if you use it frequently it might get a bit tiring. For me, I just use it here and there for work so the weight isn't really an issue. I also discovered that it works on smooth plastic that most pens won't write on, so that is a big plus (for me anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Justin Asay

customer_reviews.title: Not practical enough to EDC, but a cool-looking pen
customer_reviews.text: As far as pens go, this one is just a tad too "fat" to easily use everyday. It's just a little too heavy to comfortably fit in a shirt pocket or clipped to a collar. The writing point itself is as good as any disposable out there. I did get a lot of "oohs" and "aahs" over it. I seriously doubt I would ever actually need to use this pen in a tactical situation, but it is an interesting conversation starter.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moore

customer_reviews.title: This is the only pen you'll ever need and use.
customer_reviews.text: Pen works perfectly. This has withstood acid and bases from lab, dirt, and continuous use and it still feels new. After writing a lot, I tend to hold a death grip on the pens and bend the plastic ones, so this pen is just perfect. Make sure that when refilling, to NOT LOSE THE SPRING that goes on the cartridge. Without it, the cartridge will not hold and will not stay in place inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously Thick
customer_reviews.text: It's too bulky to pass as a pen, and is just slightly smaller than a dry erase marker so it's hard to use it as one if you wanted. It has a glass smasher, but wouldn't work well to stab with and why are you punching someone? Basically it fails as an innocuous self defense weapon, and it fails as a pen... so what do you actually need this for?
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Durable pen, Cheap Price, comes with lots of ink.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to grip, comes with a lot of extra ink, and built for durability. I don't consider it in any way actually "tactical" beyond the glassbreaker but that's a gimmick for the majority of people but I do think it's a good pen if you're a mechanic or something and don't wanna destroy your pen. The price is pretty great for what you get and I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee_E

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars, after replacing the ink cartridge
customer_reviews.text: Use this all day long for taking notes at my desk job while on the phone and really love it. I get a fair amount of compliments. Haven't tested the glass breaker but have no concerns. The ink cartridges it came with were both terrible, however given the price for this, it's a really small complaint. Pick up the Parker GEL ink refills and it'll be perfect. Stock ones would stop writing intermittently. Feels solid in the hand. Certainly wouldn't want to write a novel/essay with this due to the weight, but for periodic notes throughout the day it's perfect. LOVE
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 or 4 weeks of heavy WRITING use. Is this a joke?
customer_reviews.text: It broke after a few weeks. Can no longer open the pen to replace ink and can no longer twist to extend cartridge to write. Kind of a flawed design. Didn't even try hitting anything with it. 7 bucks for 3 or 4 weeks? Sure but I would just leave it in the glove box and only use it as necessary. Don't bother getting it for a field writing kit.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan Steele

customer_reviews.title: Clip is not hugely secure, but it is great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. I wish that the clip was designed more for a tighter fit. If you wear a 1.5" wide belt, this will be great. I was hoping to keep it on the molle strap on my edc bag, but it just kept sliding off. That being said, that's more like product description than a real complaint. It feels good in the hand, writes well, looks nice. I haven't tested the glass breaker. Probably should, but there aren't too many abandoned cars around me. It is hard and sharp and I feel like it would probably work.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value
customer_reviews.text: The pen has a nice quality feel to it, the metal is robust without being too heavy. The knurling is grippy without being aggressive or irritating. The pocket clip is nice and wide with a good amount of spring and retention. The mechanism for exposing the writing tip of the pen is smooth and it writes really well! All in all this is excellent value for money!
customer_reviews.author: Smithmeister

customer_reviews.title: Elegantly simple and absolutely indestructible.
customer_reviews.text: The best tactical pen I've ever owned. No stupid little lights to get damaged, no spring-loaded glass breaking nub, no end cap to get bent - just a twist to deploy the ink. Simple and as a result indestructible. And just in case you don't believe me, I'm a law enforcement officer. My Sminiker has already been used to break three car windows (relax, everyone, at their owners' request to get at locked-in pets) and still writes perfectly. If you DO need use it to break a window, I'd STRONGLY recommend wearing gloves, otherwise you'll get cut. My advice? Sminiker or don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Angelow Three

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tactical pen
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a great price. This is identical to the tactical pen sold by Yamisr. I thought I had lost this one so bought the Yamisr. Then found my lost Sminiker pen. So now I have two great pens. Heavy duty rugged pen. Love it. I have a hard time picturing how either of these pens could break, short of being run over by a tank. I also bought some gel ink refills which I really like.
customer_reviews.author: DAO

customer_reviews.title: Great value but...
customer_reviews.text: I love ALMOST EVERYTHING ABOUT IT BUT the fact it has no knurling on the lower barrel where you need the grip to write if you are heavy handed like me! However, I do use a lot of pressure on my pen whilst writing so a NORMAL person may just love this pen. I like it a lot and daily carry it but for me personally it would be all the better with some grip on the lower barrel.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Bit bulky and has heft but does the job!
customer_reviews.text: So the pen is solid and breaks glass like a charm, writing doesnt always come out the best but it writes. It's a bit akward to hold and use as an actual pen for writing with. I was very happy with the pen over all though and I'd recommend to add it to edc for people who are in line of duty or put there life on the line or save lives, whoever are in a field of work like that I can see how it would be helpful in many situations.
customer_reviews.author: Jett

customer_reviews.title: Quickly broke
customer_reviews.text: Sharp striker point, but cheap. As simple as it is, it ended up critically malfunctioning after a couple weeks. It is a twist-open, but no it just spins and not only does the pen point not deploy, but I can no longer even open the pen to tank access the refill. I thought it wasn't too bad at first--especially for the price, but now it is nothing more than a glass breaker in the shape of a non-functioning pen.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great Tactical Pen
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few tactical pens at the same time this one is by far the most durable, and simple easy to use compact design make it fool proof for anyone you gift it to. Also the price was fantastic, I will be using as an every day carry tactical pen and be buying more for my friends and family. Overall I’m extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lund

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Pen: Downfalls and Strengths
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly strong and sturdy feel, great grip but the aluminum holster/pin near the top makes using the glassbreaking side very difficult. Internals are very simple, spring, ink capsule and the two other pieces of metal confining it together. Using the pen itself is nice, it writes as any standard pen should, only downfall is the closing and opening mechanism. You have to turn the tip in order to use it. When you lock it, the pen tip will be exposed, when you turn in the opposite direction it’ll close however turning it too much might disassemble the pen into its primary components. Overall, cool and useful accessory. Could be better although.
customer_reviews.author: David Dao

customer_reviews.title: Great pen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at work. I needed a reliable pen that can withstand being exposed to various weather conditions and still let me put pen to paper without worry of failure. This has lived up to that so far and the boys and girls at work are now looking to get one of their own.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I know there are better "tactical" pens but this is definitely a dang good one for the money. I'd definitely recommend. Be careful of placement because the window breaker likes to bite. Also the textured grip is a bit agressive but I guess that's good for when you're wearing gloves and the pocket clip is definitely strong. All in all this pen is worth the money it's heavy duty and it hasn't let me down yet and it comes with extra ink so you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Burdick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tactical pen, great for gifts too
customer_reviews.text: Great tactical pen! Be aware, it get confiscated when going through TSA in Dallas, TX. I have flown internationally several times this year and have never had an issues until leaving DFW airport. Placing an order for more as we speak. Suggest buying several, as they make great gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Online_Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This pen is a great value for the price. It’s slightly thicker than other brands that I have purchased, which is a little awkward, but it’s effective. I did not appreciate the shipping of this item as it arrived in a huge box with two other items and the pen set was strewn throughout the big box. I’m just lucky that the ink cartridges did not burst.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt Attitude

customer_reviews.title: Easily broken
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pen came in the mail a few days ago. Used it enough that i had to replace ink. Used the normal twist to get it out and it snapped by just my arm force and now it wont open or push out the pen. I was supposed to trust this pen. 2nd pen to do that. Returning immediately
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: It actually writes well!
customer_reviews.text: I have had one other defender-like pens before and two things about the previous pen annoyed me - it had a cap that was possible to lose and only screwed into one side of the pen. The other annoying feature was that ink refills were difficult to find. My new Sminiker Professional Defender pen has neither of these annoying "features". It is one piece and can be used as a pen or a puncturing tool with a single decision. It also comes with several refills and as the headline states, it does write very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Bodine

customer_reviews.title: Really nice tactical pen
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Clips accepts a lot of different sizes and thickness of materials. Pen writes well and generous number of refills are provided. The glass break tip seem really sturdy and that it would definitely get the job done. Being aluminum, it is quite light and can be worn on my badge lanyard for work.
customer_reviews.author: Slimerang

customer_reviews.title: Great Pen, TSA didn't think so
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking and solid pen. It has good weight and rigidity. It can easily used as a self defense weapon. I had this pen for a year and traveled at least 20 times (air travel) with it in my backpack, domestic and international. However TSA in knoxville grabbed it recognizing it as a tactical pen.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pen and will work beautifully as a glass break ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pen and will work beautifully as a glass break tool. However, to use it as a defense tool / tactical pen you'll naturally want to put your thumb on the "cap". That is quite uncomfortable to do as the cap is quite, well, pointy. In a pinch I'm certain anyone will sacrifice their thumb to save their life, but it is quite uncomfortable to practice with and actually impale things. I picked up two different models and ended up giving this one away to someone who uses gloves for business a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Danger Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and frustration dealing with refund/replacement
customer_reviews.text: None of the included refills had ink. The pen tip retracts with minimal pressure, you have to constantly RE-deploy the pen tip as you write. I emailed the seller twice but they failed to send replacements or offer refunds. It’s a cheap pen, spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Nice... If It Worked.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these Sminiker Professional Defender Tactical Pens. One for me, and two as gifts. I started using mine before giving the others as gifts. Mine stopped working within a few weeks... that is, It would no longer extend the ink cartridge for writing by twisting the barrel. I had already given one to a friend, but kept the third. It has now stopped working in exactly the same way. I am disappointed, as the body of this pen is good looking and strong. I would love it IF it worked. It is fine as a "defensive tool", but not long lasting as a writing tool. I cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Not functional
customer_reviews.text: The pen it self does not work and add the super sharp point openly out at the end is inconvenient. How would anyone carry this with out putting holes in everything? Its also far to big to carry in your pocket and it doesn't fit in any pen slots on my coat. Sending it back asap.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Mos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome heavy duty pen
customer_reviews.text: It's worth it money wise . I work in a shipyard claiming in and out of until I've dropped it a few time but as you can see it is a heavy duty pen haven't had any issues with it and the extra refills have work good also as far about breaking a window i haven't tried that yet .
customer_reviews.author: jesus cerda III

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny. Over 2 years of use
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product this is actually my second one and the only reason I had to buy another one is because my old one fell out of my pocket and was lost. I had that first one for over two years and it never failed to write or break windows.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas K.

customer_reviews.title: I have had many, many of these pens, ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had many, many of these pens, all Uzi brand, and you have to really screw it down to deploy the ink pen and really unscrew it to retract the pen. Not with this design, just a quarter to half turn to deploy and retract the pen. This is only version I will buy from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Bill E

customer_reviews.title: Best extreme duty writing instrument & breaking glass in an emergency
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased other survival writing instruments, they all fail due to o ring dropping out or not holding up to harsh duty. I work in the HVACR field with extreme temperature changes, this pen writes in heat of 100 + to lows of - 20 Love it and am ordering more for my team
customer_reviews.author: donald r payne

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Had one before and gave it to my daughter and immediately ordered another. I used it to write but never used other features though the pens well equipped to do so. Comes with pen refills.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Rensch

customer_reviews.title: Super price on a super well-made pen that MAY save your life...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product. The price point is excellent. One of the rare occasions that the consumer is getting far more than he/she is paying for. I love the extra ink refills. Very smooth writing pen and it looks great! I get a great deal of questions/comments at the office. A reasonable price for a well-made pen that writes great that can save your life...I say but it...I am buying a dozen more to give as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Keith E. Polonoli

customer_reviews.title: Not Even Close!
customer_reviews.text: This pen is not designed for hard use. The SWAT Tactical pen is far superior to this one in build quality and function. The carbide tip on this pen is on the cap. This prevents a solid grip. You cannot use your thumb to lock the pen in your hand for thrusting. The barrel of the pen is also far less sturdy as it is a twist operation pen. This pen is less obvious to the casual observer but the SWAT pen is FAAAAR better.
customer_reviews.author: Carey

customer_reviews.title: I bought two!
customer_reviews.text: Writes super smooth and brings 5 pen refills total. The glass breaker does work, I used it at work. The texture on the top is aggressive so it may tear up your clothes, BUT, It did keep my hand from slipping when I used the glass breaker. Great for Police or any first responder. A handy edc tool as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymus

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: I tried to put a Fisher Space Pen refill in it. It did not fit in spite of some of the reviews saying it would. I put the original ink cartridge back in and now the mechanism will not retract. This pen lasted me 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: It is a great idea poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: I thought I reviewed this already. This pen is not worth the money. It is a great idea poorly executed. No matter how much I twisted the pen tip wouldn't emerge. Did I mention I had to hold the pen together as it kept falling apart ? I wish I had read all the reviews prior to purchasing, there are many glowing reviews and more than a few negative ones similar to mine. If you choose to purchase this I wish you luck and hope you get one that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best yet
customer_reviews.text: This tactical pen is so different from my other ones, it is sturdy and not so light or not cheaply made. The best part is that it is very sharp. I feel safe carrying it. And the poem works great. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: a faithful one

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Keep it in the car so you can write when needed and break a window if required. Also, consider as a pocketbook protective weapon. Excellent hand tool for writing, escape from vehicle and self protection. I have also written a positive Amazon review.
customer_reviews.author: SevenRoentgens

customer_reviews.title: Solid pen
customer_reviews.text: I have abused the hell out of the thing. I use it constantly. It has worn finish in a couple spots, but that is entirely my fault. It is a total trooper. Still works exactly just as it should. Well worth the money. I would recommend. I will eventually order a few to keep on hand to give as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: J. McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Not so tactical GREAT pen!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boss and it’s cool. However, “tactical pen” makes you think it has more function. The tip breaks glass. I guess the ridged side or clip could be used to tear some rope or something but that’s iffy. It’s a cool gift but it’s name portrays more than it is!! It’s a great pen though! Writes really well!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DEFENSIVE PEN!!
customer_reviews.text: The Sminiker defensive pen that I received was excellent in fit and finish. It has a nice weight to it, feels heavy duty, and the textured grip makes it easy to hold on to. I tested its ability to break glass and this pen did not disappoint!! I gave this pen 4 stars out of five because the image o Amazon shows it comes with four ink refills when in fact mine only came with one refill.
customer_reviews.author: REVIEW-MASTER1

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool that writes well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Writes smooth which is always good start. Refills all seem to work. Did not expect otherwise. Pen has good solid feel. Glass breaker is rather pointy so prob good for self defense as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mystwalker

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend approved
customer_reviews.text: Got this as one of the gifts to my boyfriend for his birthday and I gotta say I am impressed! It writes well and looks super cool and the fact that it comes with so many refills is wonderful! Haven't had the chance to try out the glass breaking end but that was more of a cool "oh by the way" part of the gift anyway.
customer_reviews.author: MLY

customer_reviews.title: Last one broke but I bought another.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good pen, but I had one before (in 2016) and the pen extending mechanism broke after approximately 6 months, I am hoping the new one works out better. For the price I am giving it another shot.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, solid feel.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Looks solid. Will see how it works in the real world and follow up. The packaging could have been a little better because the 6 extra refills were loose in the box. Smooth operation so far. Wish it had more functions.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: It's the one way to circumvent the dumb self-defense restrictions we have in some states where you ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a "pen". It's the one way to circumvent the dumb self-defense restrictions we have in some states where you can't have a tapered kubaton. And it's ain't too bad as an inkstick either. Glass breaker tip is a nice touch. Got one for my bf who's going off to college.
customer_reviews.author: M W

customer_reviews.title: Has basic features but not practical for real tactical use
customer_reviews.text: I really don't like this pen. It is pointed on both ends so using your palm for pressure is out unless you want to hurt yourself. Comes with a flashlight but it is easy to accidentally leave it on and kill the battery. The clip is way too big and long. Good construction and aircraft metal material but it just doesn't impress.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Nice pen!
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this pen is that the glass breaker end comes loose easily. I removed the cap and coated the threads with a little nail polish and it seems to be holding up. I'll keep you posted if it still comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: The body of the pen is fine. The problem was the pen mechanism broke after ...
customer_reviews.text: The body of the pen is fine. The problem was the pen mechanism broke after a couple of months and wouldn't retract. The seller contacted me after negative feedback and sent me another pen. I expect this one to hold up better. The second one came. One day i dropped it and out came the glass breaker. Great! How can you expect to break glass when the breaker can easily be jarred loose!
customer_reviews.author: SpringersRGreat

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Great pen, writes smooth. Takes only 1/2 turn to expose tip of pen and stops at that point. Just like other pens that require a 1/2 turn. Feels very sturdy in hand to use for self defence.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Solid pen, but I tried replacing the ink and ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid pen, but I tried replacing the ink and now the pen tip doesn't retract anymore, it only comes out and I have to press the tip back in.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Great tactical pen for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Has a good weight to it. I enjoy writing with it and just carrying it around. I use a lot of pens at work so this stays on me at all times and gets used a lot. It still has yet to fail, writing. I enjoy knowing I also have a dedicated defense aid at my side if need be, as well as a glass breaker. For the price as well, this pen is great.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Khellawan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pen, I will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid pen with a glass breaker and 6 ink refills. The pen action operates smoothly and the ball point ink cartridge writes well. The quality is impressive and the box it comes in. Which would make a great gift and not make you look cheap. I keep my pen in my truck and it gives me peace of mind. If I should ever need to break a window out or need a pen. The tactical option for defense is also a plus. 5 stars you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, great kubotan!
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first self defense weapon and I couldn't be happier! It is heavy weight but not too much, it can be harmful if you ever have to use it and the pen works great.
customer_reviews.author: Anonimous

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 of them for my shift. I’m a firefighter/EMT I expect I’ll put this pen to good use. Using it as a window punch and of course as for writing reports. Thank you for a great tool an even better gift for my shift
customer_reviews.author: billy

customer_reviews.title: Good pen, solid.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pen, and I got many compliments on it. Many people also liked taking it and playing with it. I never used to for self defense or to break a window, but I bet it could do both fairly well. My pen didnt come with a spare ink cartridge even though the package came with a space for one, which disappointed me. But overall, its a solid pen and an eye catcher for many.
customer_reviews.author: Kaptain

customer_reviews.title: Best pen for the money for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Been carry a Pilot G2 for 15+ years now, but it was time for a tactical pen. Absolutely blown away by the value. I did my research and was expecting to spend 30$ on the edc pen I wanted, but after hours of research I decided on this pen. I couldnt belive it was under 10$. Not to mention the refills and this free gift. I will most likely be using a Sminiker pen for the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October and now the ink cartridge won't move when I twist the pen to make the nib come out for writing. Now I am not able to write with it. I didn't even hit anything with it, just kept it in my pocket. Update: they have the best customer service!! After the first pen broke they replaced it immediately at no charge to me!
customer_reviews.author: Vertigo

customer_reviews.title: My first tactical pen
customer_reviews.text: This feels like a nice pen. It's not too heavy. It feels really sturdy. I don't know if I will ever have to use the point to break glass but the point feels really sharp.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lui

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, so far.
customer_reviews.text: The package the item came in is good, simple but elegant box. The pen itself is very good feeling in the hand, I'm a fan of the knurling and chamfering on the body of the pen, and the construction seems solid enough for a daily carry pen or potential defense device. The clip is secure and sturdy, the pen is comfortable to hold while writing and functions well and smoothly. I intend to carry this every day in place of more bland BIC-brand pens or mechanical pens in general.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and a good value
customer_reviews.text: Very ;well made and solid. Has a strong pocket/belt clip that will not easily release. This is my 3rd order for this pen. The first one was lost and I wanted a backup for the second one. Also great value for the price. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: M. Czajkowski

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts because of reviews, but I am glad I took the chance. Good quality. Great price. Cheap refills. Writing was good. I mean it is chunky but all tactical pens will be a bit chunky.
customer_reviews.author: Tamika Clay

customer_reviews.title: great price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these direct from a manufacturer in Arizona with a different name for three times what I got this one on amazon for. when you compare them the ONLY DIFFERENCE is the color. I travel a lot and have never had an issue going through TSA lines with it.
customer_reviews.author: TXTROUTSLAYER

customer_reviews.title: Solid Pen
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good pen got the price. Came with plenty of extra refills, writes smoothly and can do serious damage to windows or faces in cases of emergency! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: People at Slate R. Raven

customer_reviews.title: Great Pen! Great Defense Weapon!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pen. It is not one of those skinny slim jims. I want something comfortable to write with and easily gripped and held on too when protecting one's self. This product makes the cut. The only reason this did not get a 5 in my book, the black tactical coating easily wears off. This is not going to keep me from using it, just esstectically not there.
customer_reviews.author: Hoaggie

customer_reviews.title: Break a window or protect your self
customer_reviews.text: This will keep me and my family safe. I bought 3 of them so we can all have one. Unfortunately, I lost the extra cartridges for two of them though. I haven’t used the product yet, but the concept is great. I hope it works.
customer_reviews.author: kevin m johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent pen. Mine showed up missing the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent pen. Mine showed up missing the spring, so the ink cartridge would not retract until I took a spring out of a ballpoint pen and installed that. My first one went through the wash and somehow lost the glass breaker tip, so I don't know how strong these things are. As for the pen function, it won't write on most credit card receipts. The slick paper used is not compatible with this pen for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerman89

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Manly Pen
customer_reviews.text: I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this and everything good. The main drawback with this pen is that people you lend it to have a tendency to forget to return it. Tip: When using a Fisher Space Pen cartridge, you may need to file the plastic piece down a bit in diameter. You only need to do this once per pen as the plastic piece can be reused when changing ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn R Sears

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pen as a camp counselor to have something sturdy and robust to get me through the summer, and it did a fantastic job! It writes well (not great, but better than most pens I have) and is a fun fidget. After summer, the window breaking tip fell off in my school bag. As it was still within warranty, I contacted customer service, and within a day they had contacted me to send me a replacement. Product is great for it's price, and the great service makes it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Danger

customer_reviews.title: nice tactical pen, poor delivery service
customer_reviews.text: Seems good quality. Glass breaking point extremely sharp, can easily to damage to a person. Amazon logistics who delivered it poor. Day late , out for delivery 2 days unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: wizardfitz

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Solid well proportioned pen. Not too heavy or light, but will require a holster to carry as one end has a very pointy tip. Writes fairly smooth without skipping.
customer_reviews.author: A. Vera

customer_reviews.title: Just received it
customer_reviews.text: I have just received this pen. However, first impressions are good. The pen has great weight to it. Will update my review after seeing how the pen holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Got this after I had a good conversation with a person from the FBI. He showed me how to use one and said there were tons online to pick from. It's very similar to a kubotan but it writes. I bought it for my dad and he loves it. The glass breaker is a nice addition and I would probably use that side for defense rather than the pen side. The pen twists so you can put your thumb on that end easily to reinforce your defensive grip. It looks nice too...just do it!!
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little getting used to
customer_reviews.text: When You first grab this pen it feels too big, possibly clumsy however once you use it a few times you enjoy the good grip and durability of this pen. I will caution any purchaser to watch the glass breaker tip and pocket clip do come loose with use. Please watch this. When I contacted the seller after I lost the glass breaker tip and pocket clip to see if I could purchase the missing parts, they sent me a new pen with no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy Dietzman

customer_reviews.title: Great pen, terrible ink cartridge
customer_reviews.text: I love the pen, but after using it only three times in the last couple weeks (a page of writing or less total) the ink cartridge is dead. It isn't the end of the world but pretty disappointing since most of the pens I buy at the store last months. My suggestion is to pick up a replacement cartridge right out of the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Brucea73

customer_reviews.title: A little fat
customer_reviews.text: I like this thing. Especially when you compare it to others of similar build. You cant beat the price. It is a bit thick if you are using it to write with but can do.
customer_reviews.author: AbeScot

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept
customer_reviews.text: Overall- cool concept. I carried it with me daily for a couple weeks and noticed the clip was already starting to bend. Now, I can’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Jarvi

product_meta.title: Sminiker Professional Defender Tactical Pen With 6 Ink Refills Aircraft Aluminum Self Defense Pen With Glass Breaker Writing Multifunctional Survival Tool (Black)
feature_bullets: Made from aircraft grade aluminum for superior strength & Portability. it’s not only can be used window breaking and escape, but also safeguard against attackers in emergency situations, this is a MUST-HAVE to your personal survival gear.
Thread Design at the handle, excellent anti-skid ability and good grip, you can sense smooth, continuous, effortless and even ink transfer.
The tactical pen with very hard glass breaker， which can be used for emergency car window breaking when trapped in a car.
Tactical pen has a heavy duty pocket clip so that you can attach it to your shirt,pant pockets ,backpack, bags and notebook, etc. Perfect for daily use and traveling.
Package included: 1 x Tactical Pen and 6 Tactical Refill. One year satisfaction warranty & friendly customer service.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,038 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
